result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:40 AM Defendant Daiquon R Tanner in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Daiquon R Tanner.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Missed court date 9/6/22.
State indicates that the PO had talked to him about going to treatment has no issue with reinstatement. 

BTC: Vacate warrant and reinstate bond.
Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
In Custody - RCJ
Return on warrant on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
completion of SPD representation
Warrant is being forwarded to RCSO/Dispatch for entry

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $5000.00
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $500.00

9:11 AM Defendant Daiquon R Tanner not in court.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Daiquon R Tanner.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report on file. 
Atty Castro indicates the defendant's PO has him set up to go into treatment today. 
State asks for the warrant.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report- FAILURE TO REPORT
Atty Ash Castro
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.
NG plea entered.

9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daiquon R Tanner in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Daiquon R Tanner. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense requests to address bond, requesting a lower cash. DOC is still reviewing but in the event they release him would like to have a postable bond.
State objects, Believes bond is appropriate as set.
BTC: Bond motion granted, bond set at $500 cash and $5000 signature bond- same conditions.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
